name: lumpily
content:
lumpily adverb
(SHAPE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is covered with or containing lumps (= pieces of a solid substance, usually with no particular shape): Plastic sheets lumpily covered what was beneath. The figures were lumpily moulded from clay.
More examplesFewer examplesTheir wet bags were lying lumpily beside the road.

lumpily adverb
(SLOWLY/AWKWARDLY)
in a heavy, slow, or awkward way: The symphony began pretty lumpily, but the second movement moved with more grace. The manager just lumpily sat there and watched other people do things.
More examplesFewer examplesThe army had come towards them steadily and lumpily.We could hear the sound of the engine lumpily warming up.
